intro: Polygonum persicaria var. nodosum, commonly known as prickly smartweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features erect stems that are often covered in small, stiff hairs. The leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a serrated margin, while the flowers are small, clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences. It produces pink to red flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. This plant is often found in moist soils along streambanks, wet meadows, and disturbed areas.
